intro: Machaerina maingayi, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Pandanaceae and is characterized by its strap-shaped, fibrous leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fibrous leaves have been traditionally used by Māori for making baskets, mats, and other woven items. Machaerina maingayi is also valued for its ecological role in supporting native wildlife and its resilience in various environmental conditions.
